entry.et: Middle English armony, from Anglo-French armonie, from Latin harmonia, from Greek, joint, harmony, from harmos joint arm

def.dt: :the combination of simultaneous musical notes in a chord
:the structure of music with respect to the composition and progression of chords
:the science of the structure, relation, and progression of chords
:pleasing or congruent arrangement of parts a painting exhibiting harmony of color and line
:correspondence accord lives in harmony with her neighbors
:an interweaving of different accounts into a single narrative
:a systematic arrangement of parallel literary passages (as of the Gospels) for the purpose of showing agreement or harmony
